Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl839
Reviews.Content: Staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Public areas are very well appointed, clean and nicely decorated. Rooms were spacious, well appointed. Bed was comfortable, room was quiet. Our room looked over a busy road but we never heard a thing. Hotel is very close to a major train/metro/tram/bus point so transportation anywhere in the city was very easy. My only complaint would be the restaurant. We never even went in after seeing the menu prices. Appetizers were priced over â‚¬13 and entrees over â‚¬25. Nothing kid friendly on the menu what-so-ever and the courtesy coffee was non-existent (in the lobby). It would have been nice to get something to eat later in the evening after a long day but the prices were ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lily N
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel to stay at for a short holiday in Amsterdam. My husband and I stayed here for two nights over the Easter Weekend. The hotel is in the perfect location to hop on the tram and go straight into the city center for the day. Two min walk to the tram, then a 15 min ride into town. The room was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast each morning was great. Would highly recommend this hotel if your looking to save a little money by staying outside the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced hotel not too far out of town.”
Reviews.Author: OZ_Family_Abroad
Reviews.Content: This is a great option for saving a bit on money on Amsterdam accommodation as it is well priced compared to hotels right in the heart of things, while being easily accessible by the modern tram system (RAI Station). Amsterdam is never cheap but here is very good value for families. We had a room with two double beds which was very clean and in a modern building with nice furnishings and good service at both the restaurant and the front desk. This is also a pick-up point for one of the tour companies which offers a free hotel pick up service that takes you into the city to join either there "Hop on Hop off" busses or another one of their many tours around the city and dutch country side, which was really handy and very easy being we were travelling with a 4 & 5 yr old. The restaurant had a very nice buffet breakfast which was included in the price and included eggs (in multiple ways) and other hot items including bacon, baked beans, hash browns, grilled tomatoes, pancakes etc, plus a lovely assortment of pastries, fruit, breads, spreads, cereals and Juices. The room also had some TV channels in English for adults and kids. No complaints about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a family at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ts846
Reviews.Content: We, family of 4 booked this hotel after looking at various expensive alternatives within the centrum. This hotel is about 10 to 15 minutes by tram to all major attractions and is 2 minutes walk from Rai train and tram station. You can get a direct train to Rai from Schipol. The hotel staff were happy to take care of luggage, since we arrived in the morning. Room was spacious with two double beds. We did not have breakfast as we felt it was expensive. It is possible to get a decent breakfast at cafe's for 6 to 8 euros. I used the fitness centre and it was well equipped. We bought the three day unlimited travel card and hence travelling was not a problem. Only other gripe would be the Internet charges and the lack of wifi. Overall I think this would be a good reasonable option for families in Amsterdam considering how difficult it is to get a reasonable family room in the main areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel bit far from main city”
Reviews.Author: ashish_dhr
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good and rooms were clean and nice size.Hotel is very near to the train station but it takes some time to reach the main city.If you plan to come to Hotel during the day ahve some rest and again go back it will not be best choice i would say but for normal tourists who leaves hotel in morning and comes back in evening its a excellent place to stay.Brekfast served in hotel restaurant was also very good being vegetarian there were enough options to eat.Overall very good stay and would like to stay again if comes back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Holiday Inn in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: For a number of years, I have stayed regularly at the Holiday Inn in Amsterdam and I feel moved to share with you my happy experience. For me, it is like a home from home. I am always assured of a welcoming smile from everyone on reception. In the bar, the staff will always engage you in witty conversation and cannot do too much to make your stay a happy one. The rooms are always extremely comfortable and clean. All the staff seem to be extremely well motivated to provide excellent service

Reviews.Title: “RAFA Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: My organisation staged a Christmas buffet brunch at the hotel which was attended by 70 persons. The cuisine was absolutely first class and reasonably priced. Reports back from the participants have been very positive. This was the second time we have staged the event at this hotel and we are so pleased with the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff, nothing was too much for them. In October my organisation will be holding a two day conference at the hotel with delegates and visitors attending from various European countries. The weekend programme will not only include meetings but also will include a Gala Dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service all around; very proactive”
Reviews.Author: Paul N
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Everything was in order from check-in to check-out. Restaurant staff was responsive and the Vermont staff was super! Can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “near to the train station”
Reviews.Author: joeqatar
Reviews.Content: Good value for money with nice location near to the bus station and train station. The rooms are large enough and has all amenities you could think of with a nice view to the city. The staff is nice and very helpful. For the price what you are paying you cant ask for more. Nice hotel for business or family.

Reviews.Title: “Mean spirited”
Reviews.Author: ridcroft
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the good points: This hotel is well situated close to Metro, Tram, and Railway stations. This makes travel into Amsterdam or out to the Airport really easy. The rooms are standard Holiday Inn, although the 'Corner' rooms (6 and 17) are larger and there was a safe in the one I had. The bathroom is a good size and the shower works well. The beds are large and reasonably comfortable. Breakfast in the Vermont Restaurant is a standard Holiday Inn buffet offering Continental and UK/US style cooked food. As a business hotel this ticks most of the boxes. Now we come to the title of this review. Please bear in mind this is a 3/4 star hotel charging accordingly. The toiletries are attached to the wall. The hotel does not provide a facecloth and has removed mine on occasion (return was promised but did not happen). There is a minibar of the 'touch it and pay' variety but no fridge. The mugs provided with the kettle are cup sized, not mug sized. TV reception is poor the image has interference. The reception staff are with one notable exception courteous without being friendly and at checkout have never enquired if I enjoyed my stay. I write this review as a Platinum priority Club member who has used this hotel on several occasions. My benefits here extend to a bottle of water and a glass! My 'guaranteed upgrade' means the water is in the room before I arrive thus making it 'an upgraded 'business room'. I know these are all little things but for me they create an overall impression that this hotel does not care and is mean spirited. People will stay here because it is convenient, and most are on Business. Perhaps the newly opened Crown Plaza nearby will encourage them to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GinJess
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Amsterdam is nicely situated next to a tram stop, and 24-hour tram tickets can be bought from the Porter in the Hotel lobby (we did the research and a 24-hour tram ticket is an excellent value choice for travel about Amsterdam). The staff is helpful - Provide maps, advice, and will look up information. The hotel is clean and comfortable. There is a small, but very well furnished Fitness Room. The Hotel restaurant is lovely and not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “hartstikke gezellig en gastvrij - very cosy and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Andrasandra
Reviews.Content: I was immediately struck and moved by the openness and frankness of the hotel staff. It puts the visitor not only at easy, but makes him/her feel at home right a way. I enrolled in the Priority Club. The head porter, Theo Kerpentier, has a lot of humor and we laughted a lot. I have to mention Maurice Rouwers as well: he was simply sensational in his cool, humorous approach of the customers. I had also a wonderful feeling in the Dutch Present Shop and appreciated the freshness of Sandra Kroonenberg. The Holiday Inn Amsterdam is definitely the place to be! With warm regards, AndrÃ¡s (LÃ¡szlÃ³): alaszlo@skynet.be

Reviews.Title: “New Year, New experience!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParisfan
Reviews.Content: We returned to Amsterdam for a Birthday celebration, this time crossing over the New Year. Being quite late booking, I was unable to find a reasonable priced central hotel, that could guarantee a 'proper' bed for my daughter who was accompanying us. Having experience of the Holiday Inn group, I was pleased that their hotel was a good price, but concerned about the apparent distance from the centre. Not a problem as it turned out as it is Idealy located near a transport 'hub' with Metro, tram and bus all available a short walk away. 15 Min journey and you are in Central station. Less if you visit the museum quarter! Reception were friendly and efficient. The room was pleasant and had 2 large beds, so my daughter slept well! Bathroom was clean and a reasonable size. Despite being a Platinum Card holder I wasn't offered an upgrade, but the room was quite sufficient for our needs, even as we were staying a full week. The safe was spacious, the TV had english language channels. We didn't sample the Minibar, but it was well stocked. Food was fine. A generous breakfast each morning. We didn't eat at the hotel as the restaurant was closed (I presume for the new year?) but bar food was available. The bar itself was also nice, friendly staff and not (too) expensive. New year itself was.. well.. Different? Thanks are owed to the reception and bar staff who all warned us that the public transport stopped at 8pm, so to be sure we were where we wanted to be. Thanks to the warning we were well placed to catch a free, if somewhat 'europop cheesy' concert with a fantastic firework display in the field behind the Van Gogh museum. Then things got interesting! The Dutch dont seem to understand the concept that fireworks go UP, not ALONG. Everyone, and I do mean everyone is throwing fireworks about. It was honestly like being in a war zone. As we had our daughter on tow, we weren't aiming for a late night, so hunted down a taxi, and had the most 'exciting' taxi run home I've ever had. Burning debris on the road, swerving round exploding fireworks. Surreal! Big advantage of the Holiday Inn was it was far enough out to be quiet though, as the fireworks continued for hours! We however were quickly fast asleep. I'm sure no one in a central hotel could say the same! We had been unable to buy a transport pass that crossed the new year (for some reason they all expire on the 31st) but again the hotel came to out rescue as the Porter can sell transport passes at very competative prices. Our week was over again too fast. We saved on expensive Left luggage costs at Central Station as the Porter kindly stored our bags without cost, and were able to catch a train to Schipol direct from the adjoining Rail Station. There have been a few comments about the 'expensive' internet costs, and certainly if buying a package to use in your room they may have been, but as a reward card holder I was offered free WiFi in the lobby and bar, which was more than sufficient for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “The problems outweigh the non-existent positives”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: First off, this is definitely not a 4* hotel - and barely a 3* - so this review is based on the prices charged during the peak summer season for this place. If you can get it for under $100 on priceline, then maybe its OK - but don't compare this to the other 4* hotels priceline offers in the city. The tram ride is 15-20 minutes to the center and after a day or two, its not very convenient. Its fun to experience the outer neighborhoods of Amsterdam - but to a point. There are absolutely no restaurants or nice areas to hang out or walk in the near vicinity, so you are rather trapped here. The furniture, bedding, bathrooms are all dated. The temperature control in the rooms is poor - you may have to call to have them open up the sealed windows for you. The internet charges are RIDICULOUS. No wifi except in lobby and you even pay for that! The desk staff was overwhelmed the whole time I was there, with lines forming each day. They were nice enough, but it got tiring. There are no specific amenities to speak of - the little restaurant was always packed - because you don't have anywhere else to get food - and the food is edible, but for what you pay, not good. So, at a low enough price, its not an awful choice - but it doesn't have much to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gold treatment for an outstanding price”
Reviews.Author: Enoikos
Reviews.Content: Being a gold Priority Club member, I receive regularly promotional emails. In one of them, the link was redirecting to the booking engine for an Exclusive Prepaid rate. For approx 85 EUR including breakfast, the deal was unsurpassed! We got there easily since hotel is just off the highway, in the direction we were coming from. Check -in was speedy, efficient and smiley thanks to Keelem, who despite being a trainee, his professional attitude was exceptional. A big thank you from my side and hopefully more tangible benefits from his boss. I was recognised as a gold member and was offered an upgrade to the 12th floor club room, free welcome drinks and free internet. Parking is 25EUR per stay ... so despite parking sign for 24hrs a certain degree of flexibility is allowed for late check-outs or next day late evening return to pick up your car.Free paking on the weekends on the side road. Hotel is perfectly situated in the same building block, literally 50 meters away from the tram 4 start station. It will take you in the town-center in approx 20 mins. The daily travel card acquired by tram driver is only 7EUR. Sleep quality typically great as in every Holiday Inn, with king size bed excellent mattress and choises of pillows. Breakfast was simply great. Huge selection, oranges for a freshly made juice, hot dishes, great cappuccino etc etc. All in all, a gold treatment for an excellent and inexpensive stay which added to our overall fantastic city break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Linda o
Reviews.Content: Good location not far from centre. Tramstops are everywhere and one close to hotel. Rooms adequate and a good size,comfortable and pleasant. Food at breakfast was good. Depends on individual tastes,but filled me up until mid afternoon.Not much going on in the area...but at least you can sleep. AND its easy to get downtown to where its all going on.

Reviews.Title: “Worn but convenient”
Reviews.Author: jhh2ogeo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has seen better days. The public rooms and the room I stayed in were worn out. My room had a faint musty smell that would not go away. The breakfasts were good but the dining room was crowded depending on your timing. This hotel is conveniently located, with easy access to the south ring road (A10), the trolly system (#4) and the rail network (RAI station is an easy walk). Don't stay here expecting to be in the 17th century portions of Amsterdam, this is in an area that is the Dutch equivilent to urban sprawl. Not particualrly a good value for the money. There are a number of nearby hotels that maybe a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay for work”
Reviews.Author: GloJul
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Holiday Inn for a course I was taking for work that was being held in their meeting area. I stayed for 5 nights. The room was big and very clean. We ate breakfast and lunch there everyday and although not gourmet quality, it was perfectly fine and there was plenty of it. Although it is in a not so pretty part of town, it is very convenient for transport to visit livelier parts of town in the evenings. It was convenient for me to stay there since my course was being held there, but otherwise, I would prefer a place in town with more atmosphere. But this was standard fare for a Holiday Inn and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Snowing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sreenug
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 3 days during 2010 Xmas time. The location was excellent, 3 mins walk to tram/metro and to business centers. The hotel is ok. The internet is not free and charges were very high. The hotel staff were good and suggested good sight seeing places and must-do in Amsterdam. Though, I was a Priority Club member, I didn't get upgrades, which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms ok, do NOT eat any food though”
Reviews.Author: peterman1976
Reviews.Content: Staying in the hotel was ok, rooms are clean, mediocre of quality, they have the nerves to give you house rules which include: Rubbish outside of your rubbish bin will be charged with 50 euro extra (don't drop any papers next to that basket with a 10cm diameter size hole!). Depending on what you want the location might be challenging. I made two mistakes yesterday, I ordered room service for lunch and had dinner in the hotel. My third mistake was going for breakfast. A breakdown: Lunch, a "special" sate (chicken with peanutsauce)->disgusting. It should be indonesian food but tasted like arab food. Dinner, returned the soup and the main course was supposed to be a duck breast. It was so tough that you could bounce it off the wall. And they charge you 8!! euros for a beer. Breakfast. Eggs were gummy as a sponge, bacon three day old, hash browns watery and the baked beans were just uneatable. I am done with this place and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but so expensive”
Reviews.Author: adrt1964
Reviews.Content: Bedroom windows dont open and air conditioning is poor so with four in the room it turns stuffy. Hotel room itself was clean but 8.50â‚¬ for an hour on the internet or 29â‚¬ for 24 hours is outrageous. Add to that the offer of breakfast for 22â‚¬ per head and indifferent staff I would give this one a miss next time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention center, otherwise average yet expensive”
Reviews.Author: gola42139
Reviews.Content: Spent five days for recent business convention at RAI. The location in relation to convention center is excellent and it is close to tram/metro. It will take you 30 minutes to get to city center. Hotel was average but very expensive. Internet access will run you quite a bit of change. Eating options are limited and will require 20 minute walk outside of hotel. Staff were very pleasant and accomodating. If you want to be close to convention center this is the place. If you want to experience Amsterdam's charms it is not.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to pay a lot for a little...”
Reviews.Author: thgoodeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a plain and simple rip-off riding the wave of Amsterdam's popularity while over-charging customers the whole way. I paid US$ 300+ for a night. When I arrived they charged e25 more for outside parking. The rooms, baths are old. TV does not even offer CNN. No wi-fi in the room. It only works on the lobby and they charge e8 per HOUR for access. Finally, it is located far from the center of town. Figure at least 30 minutes by tram as this is the last stop on the line. There are NO restaurants around so their food prices are sky-high.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: Astrid M
Reviews.Content: I would to add very positieve experiences. We are often here and the banqueting department is always helpfull, kind and flexible. The location has enough parking possibilities and it's nearby the RAI where you can use Public Transport. So, when you need a location for meetings ect. have a look at the Holiday Inn Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay- close to city tram- we enjoyed our visit”
Reviews.Author: Graham D
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful- dinner each night was very good- Arthur made us feel at home. This was our third visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if you have a conference at the Rai”
Reviews.Author: alliswell252
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for a conference at the Rai and you can't beat this hotel for the location. It is also near a train station and tram stop. The hotel itself is perfectly fine for a business hotel, although free WiFi would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in good location for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer_name
Reviews.Content: Very hard to find reasonably priced hotels in Amsterdam that will fit a family, especially easter weekend. We ended up at the Holiday Inn because they offered a room with 2 queen beds plus breakfast. Hotel is an easy walk to RAI station where you can pick up train, subway or tram in one convenient spot. The hotel sells all-day tickets or you can buy them on the tram. The room was in line with our expectations - a little cramped but it was clean and fit our needs, we don't spend a lot of time in a hotel anyway so the amenities are not that important to us. Extra charge for internet was very high even for Europe. The full breakfast had a large variety of tasty hot and cold foods but the hotel seemed unprepared for the easter weekend traffic - they ran short of plates and utensils several times. If you have kids with you, the Amstelpark across the street is an excellent place to run off some energy - two playgrounds, a small area with carnival-style rides, and a kid-size train, all within an easy walk from the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful in answering our questions about how to get around Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christa1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with hubby and 2 children. Large clean room, 2 double beds. We were on the 5th floor, but the windows didnt open at all, the room became very stuffy during the night. The vent fan in the bathroom was on all night. Mini bar prices were laughable. The reception staff were very helpful, we arrived 3 hours earlier than the 2pm check in, this was no problem and we were booked in straight away. The hotel is located a minutes walk from the number 4 tram terminal, this tram takes you straight into the city centre. There is also a huge bike rental shop nearby. All in all a good hotel, clean, helpful and friendly, just wish the windows could open.

Reviews.Title: “really bad”
Reviews.Author: SyleLondon
Reviews.Content: When our room was booked the internet and breakfast was included but the reception had no idea because no one has informed or leave a comment, poor service. They promise us to talk to Linda Reservation manage to sort the problem Room was good size but the windows are dirty from outside looks like been not clean for at list couple of months. Bar expensive but experience bartender. They charge 22 Euros for internet p/day which is way to much for any kind of standard. Breakfast is really bad if not included will cost you 22 Euros p/person and I promise you will regret it. Location is far from old town and centre, business distract is about 10min walk. When we checked out the bill was still additional charges internet and breakfast on we ask again this to be removed and took another 10min to resolve the issue. Bad service, location far from town, breakfast really poor. Try other places

Reviews.Title: “Ok place”
Reviews.Author: KF1966
Reviews.Content: I would call it a "ok" place. No big surprises. Clean rooms with usual ammenities. Free wifi is only accessible from the lobby (even for Priviledged members), which nowadays is a pitty. The parking is pretty expensive and you don't have to choice of finding a free parking spot outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: AshBH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay and maybe a 3.5 star, but not the 4-star hotel that Priceline said it was. Pros: - Clean - Comfortable bed - Decent room Cons: - Mediocre customer service bordering on unfriendly (except Kamal (sp?) at concierge) - Provided two thin towels (usually a 4-star will give you 4 towels) - No ice bucket (though there were ice makers in the hotel - though about 1/2 of them didn't work) - Seemed like hotel was trying to cut corners/costs and be money grubbing at every turn - for example, only one plastic glass in the room (you can't give me two?), the Wifi in the lobby was 8.50euro/hour. - No Wifi in the room - and the internet in the room is 24euro a day (!!) and it's a darn cord - Definitely not in the heart of things (though near Amstelveen, and the RAI station, so you can get into town relatively quickly - it's just not that pretty where the hotel is situated) The biggest bummer was checking out this morning - I had called and asked for 30 min extra and check out at 12:30pm. Fine, no problem, they said, adding, "But you must leave at 12:30". Um, okay, I did pay you for 5 nights, I'm not exactly squatting by staying an extra 30. 20 minutes after I had called, someone else called me and was very rude telling me check out was at noon - though I had just called 20 min earlier and they said it was fine. As I was trying to leave my room and get my luggage out, the door closed - and then my key wouldn't get me back in b/c they had coded the door to lock me out. They could have at least waited until I had come downstairs and checked out. before locking me out. The hotel was just kinda - well, jerky. Wouldn't stay there again, especially when there are a lot nicer hotels at the same cost with a lot more nicer people working at them.

Reviews.Title: “Banqueting staff and services much appreciated”
Reviews.Author: Auke P
Reviews.Content: As part of the International Mathematics Olympiad we stayed in this hotel and used most of the meeting rooms of the hotel. I thought the breakfast was very good, extensive and of high quality. One suggestion for the early morning staff: watch out with how much and about what you talk together. Personally I don't really mind staff sharing their personal lives together, but guests shouldn't hear / notice. The service of the staff at the meetingrooms was really great. It was very nice having familiar (staff) faces around during the 4 days we were present, and it felt like they really tried their best to make our stay as pleasant and successfull as possible. And it sure was! I also like to note the coffee breaks: I thought the variety of (home made) cookies, candy and fruit was really nice... especially since we made such long hours....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: robmat_11
Reviews.Content: As a Priority Club Platinum Member, this was easily the absolute worst hotel we stayed at when visiting France, Italy, Turkey & Netherlands over 21 days and as many hotels, the majority of the staff were arrogant and full of their own self importance, friendly service was non existent and the rooms were 2 star at best, no mini bar, fridge was locked, no tea & coffee, absolute shocker, E25 per night for car parking, simply outrageous

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently clos to convention centre”
Reviews.Author: Holiday1043
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just a few minutes walk from the RAI convention centre, but far from city centre. The tram is nearby, but the ride still takes a while (about 20-30 min?). Hotel is nice and clean, good breakfast selection and rooms have comfortable beds, no disturbing traffic or nightlife, BUT itÂ´s very expensive to use the internet! Have stayed at several Holiday inns in other countries with no additional cost for that. Beware of pickpockets and thefts at the nearby train station! (But then again it could happen almost anywhere in any big city)

Reviews.Title: “wireless internet only strong enough in lobby”
Reviews.Author: SamTheCalifornian
Reviews.Content: Given this is a business hotel next to the RAI convention center the wireless internet signal is not strong enough to reach the floors only in the lobby. THe lobby is quiet enough to answer all the days' e-mails. This limit me to average but it can be very good ranking. Otherwise the complimentary breakfast is OK but after 5 days it is getting boring. Location is excellent 2 minutes walked to the RAI train station and 10 minutes ride from the airport. Transportation is very convenient. Rooms are relatively quiet where the walls can keep out most of the noises. Amsterdam is easy to travel around and there is a final train station close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from the action”
Reviews.Author: tmora2
Reviews.Content: The title is self esplanatory. The hotel was clean and everyone was nice but far from the attractions. Close to metro and tram stops but somewhat confusing to learn how to use both.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place to get stuck at”
Reviews.Author: Beanbag109
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in Amsterdam durring a snow storm, and stayed here. Nice rooms, and a great restaurant. The picture is of the sample platter from the restaurant. It was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, didn't expect to pay for television”
Reviews.Author: MCUNDERWOOD
Reviews.Content: Great location and very nice rooms. Disappointed there was a fee for television and internet service. Local bus service was convenient for late night travel to bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Inn Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kit138
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a conference. At first, I thought the experience would be like those cheap motels in the States, but guess what, it was like a 3 star hotel. The experience was good. The room was big and clean and the employees were friendly. The location was good and very close to the train station. Although the hotel should be 10 mins from the airport by train, I took the wrong train (as advised by the train station staff) and took me 2 hours!. The only down side was that the food was just ok. I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean Hotel and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: eurofoxjvd
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel nearby city centre. Hotel is clean and provides different kinds of extra services. Because of the friendly and professionel staff, we always come back (for business) to this Hotel. Extra compliments for Zia, Pedrag and Leo; These gentlemen are always standby for extra help and service.

Reviews.Title: “Major employee attitude, watch your charges.”
Reviews.Author: SandroDTW
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel via Expedia and prepaid online. Expedia advised me that a sum equal to 5 % of the bill would have to be paid directly at the hotel. Fine, no problem, will comply. At check-in, girl had major attitude, such as that she did not even let me finish initial sentence. My first idea of this? â€œDo not bother me, I am doing something elseâ€¦â€�. Next day asked staff to exchange some bills, from large denomination Euros to smaller and they sent me to a bank, with the excuse of being "we just started the work shift" and "the bank is just a few minutes awayâ€�. It took me a good two hours to go the bank and back, but at this time I understood not to bother the front personnel againâ€¦ The night before leaving, I went to pay in cash for the 5 % local tax as stated by Expedia. Clerk collected cash from me and when I asked for receipt told me â€œnot to worry as it was in the computerâ€� (WOW!). When I insisted to get a receipt, he shuffled papers around, called a supervisor (who did not either bothered to acknowledge me) and after quite some time I got my receipt. Clearly, at every experience at the front desk, I did not feel welcomed. Nonetheless, I came back home and I found a charge of 44 Euros on my credit card. Thankfully, I have been a loyal American Express customer for many years and they gave me credit right away but Holiday Inn Amsterdam once again? No thank you! And by the way, Mr. Hartman, please do not send me any marketing-approved, customer reply letters to this complaint: rather than spending your time on typing letters to upset customers on Trip Advisor, let me suggest you to train your employees more often and better!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: SAW51
Reviews.Content: My room on the 11th floor had good views, was quite spacious, modern and neutrally decorated. The bathroom was clean but felt somewhat tired - scuffed basin, brown marks round the plughole and very slow-draining bath. The wall-mounted combined shampoo/shower gel dispenser and no conditioner feels cheap. The air conditioning was just about able to cope with the unseasonably hot weather. I particularly disliked the laminated "house rules" laying out the consequences of noise, smoking, use of drugs, extra cleaning charges for rubbish left on the floor - it wasn't clear whether this says something about the hotel or something about the guests! The restaurant both for breakfast and dinner was ok, but nothing special. On the upside, it's really convenient for meetings in the Rai area and for the conference centre, and is easily reached from the airport. The staff were also friendly. Fine for a short business trip but I would not recommend for a weekend break or vacation (as it's well out of the centre).

Reviews.Title: “Accessible and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: lincolnlady64
Reviews.Content: On recent business trip to Amsterdam, i had flown in two days early to sight-see before moving on to our meeting hotel which was actually an hour outside the city. The hotel was recommended by one of our sales people and not knowing the area I went with it. It is not in the heart of the city but getting around to attractions and restaurants is very convenient. First it is only two stops on the train from the airport (3 euro) and less than a block to access the tram system. The hotel is clean, comfortable and service is very friendly and helpful. If there is any drawback is that the breakfast buffet if you do not get it with your room rate is 22 euro ($30.00) per person. Rooms are well appointed and clean. Front desk was more than willing to help give suggestions on resturants or tourist spots that are must sees if there for the first time. Everyone and not only in the hotel speaks English.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for those attending RAI”
Reviews.Author: smileyric
Reviews.Content: This hotel has meeting rooms, comfortable bedrooms and a modest restaurant staffed by enthusiastic and willing workers. The food was never less than good. Conveniently placed about 600 yards from the RAI conference centre and about 800 yards from a local street containing a number of adequate restaurants, it can be reached by both trains and trams. From Schipol airport it is 2 train stops taking fifteen minutes and costing 3 euros single. From the centre of Amsterdam it is at the end of tram line 4 which takes about 20 minutes from Centraal station. Both tram and train stations are between the RAI and the hotel and easy walking distance with a case on wheels. (No more than 5 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is OK but not better than OK”
Reviews.Author: Nico_bxl
Reviews.Content: Beds are good, breakfast too. But when I entered the room there was still waste in the bin in the bathroom and a rasor was left. Staff ok but not really friendly (it depends, night staff not really friendly but day staff more. Parking is expensive. Wifi too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: 7dust
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be recommended to all visiting RAI Exhibition center. It's 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Also, the train/subway station is VERY close (2 minutes), Schiphol Airport is 5 minutes by train and the Amsterdam center is reachable by either subway or tram within 10-15 minutes. It's quite pricy though.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: barsmi_blues
Reviews.Content: I have used the Holiday inn a lot of times on Business over the past 9 months. Mainly because it is ideally located close to access to Trains/Metros and Trams, and also the staff are very helpful and friendly. In particular Zeer (not sure if iI have spelt his name right), who looks after the Bar, always makes you feel welcome with some good 'banter' and good service. Well done to Zeer and the rest of the Bar Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Trusted hotel chain, conveniently located on tram line”
Reviews.Author: Mumm3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a party of 2 adults & 2 children. The hotel lived up to my expectations of a Holiday Inn. Nice, clean rooms & attentive staff. The beds are small doubles but each fit 1 child & 1 adult fine. The tram stop was very close - even closer if you go via the side door (closed after 9pm)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location + outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Epeniche
Reviews.Content: Special thanks to Arthur at the hotel restaurant for his outstanding service. You really make a difference with the fabulous customer service attitude. Excellent location walking distance from the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay but bad staff”
Reviews.Author: alzoy
Reviews.Content: Being platinum card members, we had requested for an early check-in and high floor both of which was not given. We were made to wait for an hour and then tried to be put in an average room on a low floor; which we refused after looking around it.After another wait at the reception we were finally served by a senior staff who was helpful and apologetic about the misunderstanding and gave us a much better room on the 10th floor(priority floor no11 had no family suites) and even send us an apology note along with a plate of fruits and wine(we returned the wine as we do not partake alcohol); which I thought was considerate. Good thing was the hotel's proximity to the RAI station both for travel to the airport and the city by train and metro respectively. Also the tram station stop is much closer ,for city travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: yves_marien
Reviews.Content: Have been staying a lot in this hotyel for the last 8 months. Never been disappointed. Great Service. Excellent bar and bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent people, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NadsF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just outside of the main city so does not suffer from late night revellers passing by your window. The bar staff (Zia, Leo and Pedrag) are allways on hand to assist and although the menu is limited they and the chefs (Maurice and Arjan) are prepared to cook you something off menu so long as you give them some forward notice. The reception staff are also friendly and always on hand to help with any questions. The rooms are comfortable and of a great size, especially when compared to other hotels in Amsterdam. Beds are very comfortable and a range of pillows are available to suit. Located within a 5 minute walk of the number 4 tram that will take you straight to central station (and all the stops in between) and also within 5 minutes from the Station Rai where there are regular train links to Schiphol Airport and with regular metro's to the city. Within 15 minutes walk are some good restaurants, including an Indonesian, Thai, Japanese and Italian. The Rai exhibition station is within 10 minutes walk. Whether for business or pleasure I would recommend this hotel for a pleasant and hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, medium service”
Reviews.Author: drorcohen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with my family (includes small kids). The location is close to the tram - 1 minute walk - and within 15 minutes you're in dam square. The receptionists were not so helpful and didn't give the feeling they'll do what they can to help only what they have to... I asked if they could call and reserve a taxi for the airport but because I gave them the number and didn't use their taxi station they refused...good point for kids - a big park is near by with lots of playgrounds and minigolf. Bad point for kids - restaurants are 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if it's the last room in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: israelifamily
Reviews.Content: Beware! Don't mind the Hotels polite response, that will be added on as a routine. We fell for the " if its so far away, its probably good" drill. It's not! the hotel is simply awful. Our room had miny queen size beds (they measured them, and claimed theyre standard...) the service was below any standard; rude and impolite. For 3 consecutive days we asked for our bathroom to be fixed, and got various responses all rude. Finaly Miriam when confronted said, "we fixed what we can...", which was little.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: doronbresler
Reviews.Content: Please note that this Holiday Inn isn't the American brand you think it is. I tried to cancel a reservation because of passport problems but they would not allow me to do so. I reserved online and apparently this is the kiss of the death. They consider this prepaid and won't amend the reservation at all. I suggested a change to a later date and they said that this reservation is locked in without any possible changes. So rest assured that reservations on the Holiday Inn website is not the way to go. Extremely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrToddR
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the flavor of Amsterdam, this is not the hotel to stay at. The service quality was more of a Holiday Inn Express at Holiday Inn pricing. It is not located in walking distance to any of the " must see sites". A Taxi will cost you close to 25 Euros to get downtown. Alternatively there is a Public Tram system that is in walking distance, once you ask about it. It does stop at midnight. As a visitor you would expect the hotel to let you know about this alternative public system, but it was not mentioned until I asked, I over heard other guest asking and they were directed to a taxi. This hotel is great for business conferences but not for the leisure traveler who wants to experience Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a non-central location with easy access to public transport”
Reviews.Author: BSM001
Reviews.Content: Had a quick weekend stay in Amsterdam and stayed here. While it's not in the center of all the action, the location is perfect for easy access to the train, metro and tram. The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly. I was very impressed with the fitness center -- I had a "real" workout for the first time at a hotel. Only gripe with the property is the internet is ridiculously overpriced (22 Euros for 24 hours or 8.50 for 1 hour) and there is no WiFi in the rooms -- just wired access. Also of note -- the only dining options are the hotel restaurant and the hotel restaurant next door. I'd recommend eating in the city before returning to your room. Be sure to visit the Riekermolen Windmill -- just a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Was a perfect way to start a Sunday morning.

Reviews.Title: “A good value non central hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the Holiday Inn was in a busy, more industrial area, it was very quiet inside. The staff were polite and helpful. It is a 20 min tram ride to the city centre, but we enjoyed seeing more of the city that way. The tram, train and metro is two mins from the side entrance to the hotel. Buy a 24hr ticket (â‚¬7) on the tram to give you unlimited use of the tram abd metro all day. Tram stops are hard to find at first...you cannot hail a tram and stops are far fewer than for English buses, but we soon got used to the system. The hotel restaurant sells traditional Dutch food, as well as some bar food. It is a little pricey. Breakfast was outstanding....a huge choice from cooked to continental...though it was â‚¬22 a person. We had a 'kids eat free voucher' so that made it â‚¬11 each for us (2 adults and 2 teenagers) We filled up with breakfast then didn't eat again until the evening. Our room was clean and modern, but it contained too much furniture. The two arm chairs were impossible to sit in as they were jammed against the bed! The beds, described as 'Queen sized' at booking, were what an English person would describe as a standard double...very squashy for us as we are used to a super king! Only one pillow each was provided, so we asked for more, and they were delivered in minutes. The towels in the bathroom were terribly thin, but basic toiletries were provided. The maids did a fantastic job of tidying and cleaning our room each day. The coffee making facilities were hidden in a draw and we didn't find them until the last day! This is a goid, basic budget hotel for those who don't mind travelling into the city each day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, 20 Minutes from the Centre”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-Marie1984
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming at reception we only used the hotel as a bed for the night but everything looked lovely. The beds very comfortable and even better not being in the centre as there was no noise, perfect nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “An explicit mail address to ask clarifications”
Reviews.Author: silvia092
Reviews.Content: Good morning, Please be so kind to provide an explicit email address where to ask clarifications about a supplemental amount of money retained from my credit card. I stayed in this hotel in November, for 4 nights, I paid in advance, at check out it was confirmed twice that I do not have any charge. Nevertheless an amount of money was retained from my credit card. If I click on icon with â€œemail hotelâ€� there where â€œHotel front Deskâ€� and â€œHotel faxâ€� are displayed I receive this message â€œCould not perform this operation because the default mail client is not properly installedâ€�. Being in holidays (till 10 of January) I cannot use the fax and to have a long distance call for clarifications, it appears to me not cost effective. My e-mail address is florescu.silvia@gmail.com Thank you in advance, Silvia Florescu

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow777
Reviews.Content: Probably suitable hotel for business trip but not for family leisure...As another reviewer wrote "There was nothing wrong with the place, but I don't feel like it was a good value for the money.â€� agreed. What pissed me off is the staff attitude which is why I wouldn't go back to this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sreyashi
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks nice, the staff is multi-lingual and friendly, and there's concierge for your luggage. The front desk people were nice and accommodating. My reservation said check time was 2 PM, but I had an early morning flight and I arrived at the hotel at 7AM and found my room ready to move in. It was a big relief after a long flight. The room is of decent size, well furnished, looks nice, and is clean. It's confusing though, there's no menu for the restaurant lying around, and part of the restaurant's menu is inbuilt into the TV menu system. I would have preferred a printed menu. There's a mini bar. It is not in the inner city but 5 minutes from the subway and train station RAI, which means you can get there by public transport easily if you arrive by plane or train. It also takes you 15 minutes to get to the inner city with the metro. It is an ideal starting point for exploring the city and its surroundings. I would recommend this hotel if you want a hotel in easy reach of the city centre and Schipol Airport. There is a direct 12 minutes train from RAI station to the Schipol.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with all modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: dtf100
Reviews.Content: Location somewaht outside of the center, but walking distance to the conference facilities. Professional staff, rooms equipped wih all modern amenities that a business traveller may need. Spacy and quiet room, comfortable bed with good selection of pillows. Staff was very helpful and friendly and definitely "did go the extra mile" to satisfy clients - even though the hotel was fully booked as a result of a major conference.

Reviews.Title: “Saved me from a disaster”
Reviews.Author: RiverCherwell
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay in a more central location, but with fairly good transportation around, Holiday Inn Amsterdam is still a good choice. One thing I would like to point out is, the ticket machine at the train station would not accept notes/credit card. This will definitely catch you by surprise if you are in a hurry to the airport. So, be sure you have enough changes to buy your tickets, especially you are with a large group like me. Fortunately, I immediately went back to the hotel and the lady at the reception kindly offered me some changes I much needed. So, if you are the manger of this hotel and you are reading this, it would be very helpful to make sure your hotel have adequate spare changes ready for travellers like me. Overall, had a great time in Amsterdam and I recommend Holiday Inn Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to congress center but not close to city center”
Reviews.Author: fcbenni
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Amsterdam is located very close to the congress center RAI and to the train station with direct connection to the airport. However to the city center you need to plan 20 min (Metro), 35 min (Tram). The rooms are average and a little bit older. It happened to me that I had some spider in my room. However otherwise the bathroom and room itself are clean. The hotel offers a restaurant and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Nice Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunshineFL221
Reviews.Content: A typical Holiday Inn. It was in a bit of an industrial area. A train station was close by and there was a park across the street for jogging. They call their bar Vermont and they have a sign that says â€œEat, Drink and Be Vermontâ€� so we asked what Vermont meant, thinking it was a dutch word and the answer was that â€œVermont is a State in the United Statesâ€�. (the decorations list the names of some of the cities in Vermont, a state we know quite well) . As Platinum Priority Club members, we had a nice welcome package including a small bottle of red and a small bottle of white South African wine. There was a fitness center that was of typical quality and there were several English language TV stations. All in all a nice location and value. Internet was a fee as was parking but since it was a weekend, the staff directed us to free parking outside of their lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the money”
Reviews.Author: marianj1
Reviews.Content: I Had read some review regarding it being not so good of a location.My husband and I stay there and we found it to be conveniently located to the tram or the metro,but you must use the side door and wait right there next to the little break station at the last stop not the one in front of the station with is only a few yards further.

Reviews.Title: “Nearer to tram than other reviewers said plus things to avoid”
Reviews.Author: lloydstephens
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel but before booking we checked the reviews and nearly did not book it as some reviewers said it was 10 minutes walk to the tram stop. This is not the case. If you leave by the side entrance / exit, then the walk is probably is only about three minutes! The tram costs only 15 euros for unlimited trips over 72 hours. Into the centre of Amsterdam within 15 minutes. As it is the first stop you always get a seat on the way in. Things to avoid Breakfast at the hotel is 20 euros per person and it basically hot trays of pre cooked scramble eggs and sausages etc. The coffee is pretty bland and it is not worth the money. The in room internet is expensive too at 29 euros! We had breakfast at a place called Bagels and Beans, which also had free wi-fi. Thus saving about 40 euros a day, and with better food and connection. But the service was fantastic, the room clean and large. Very quiet, good air con. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “BAD CHECK-IN & OUT !!! BAD COMMUNICATION, PAY THE LITTLE EXTRA STAY IN AMSTERDAM SQUARE”
Reviews.Author: Fayep88
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two evenings in July 2010, we arrived during the daytime , the concierge allowed us to change in a conference suite which was great as we were too early to check in. We returned in the evening to check in the receptionist was told that we would like to pay cash for accomodation but would leave a mastercard for security purposes, he then went onto authorise my friends card for the full accomodation price and refused to take the cash off us, as young girls travelling alone we wanted to pay there and then so that we were not carrying large amounts of cash, He was dismissive and just took the card and authorised what he pleased. I found the hotel interior to be really nice and very clean, although the bathroom did not have enough towels there was one towel in a twin room. The hotel i found to be too far from the city centre was taking upto 40 mintues on a tram or costing 20 euro in a taxi, next time i visit amsterdam i will pay the small difference in rates and stay in Amsterdam Square. When checking out I stood at the desk for 20 minutes before check out was completed, apparently because the system was down although the two next computers were fine, receptionist did not apologise for my wait or even ask if my stay was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gillian_moran
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend with friends in Amsterdam. We arrived much earlier than check in and were greeted with a very friendly face at reception Mari ( hope I have spelt that correctly) She was lovely a credit to the holiday Inn. So helpful. All the staff were really lovely, a fantastic clean friendly hotel we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mark-southside
Reviews.Content: Many people who go to Amsterdam will want to stay in the city centre in a boutique or character hotel and a suburban chain hotel such as this may not suit them. However we wanted a safe and reliable hotel we could drive to but could quickly access the city centre and this ticked all the boxes. The hotel is near the RAI (Convention Centre) and was easy to reach by car, assisted by GPS. There is an adjacent Q Park car park but its intended for weekday office staff and expensive. The hotel has its own small surface (chargeable) car park but we opted for street parking which is free at weekends and we had no problems. The check-in and check-out was fast and the staff very helpful. Our room was nicely made up with a double bed for us and a sofa bed for our son. There was the usual range of Holiday Inn services and facilities. The hotel is a couple of minutes walk to the Metro/NS station which takes 10 minutes to the city centre but we decided to take the Tram instead which is longer but gives you a ground view of Amsterdam life. An 24hour public transport ticket costs 7Euros which is good value. The ticket machine in the Metro (not NS - railway) entrance to the station dispenses these tickets and accepted my UK credit card. It is also possible to buy 24hour tickets from tram conductors (or drivers where there is none). After a full day and a good nights sleep we had the buffet breakfast which is not cheap for British standards at 22Euros but kids dine free and the offer is a quality one including smoked salmon and scrambled eggs - my favourite. When I am in Amsterdam again this is the hotel I would chose

Reviews.Title: “Great comfort and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MarionB01
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stayover at the hotel, room was wonderful, bed and linen very comfortable, great nights sleep. Very friendly staff and afterwards when we queried whether we could purchase pillows, staff at the hotel went out of their way to contact and accommodate us. Also convenient for airport and amsterdam. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good as always”
Reviews.Author: sang10
Reviews.Content: My earlier Holiday Inn stays have always been very comfortable - that is the reason I booked this hotel on my trip to Amsterdam. And I was not disappointed. I traveled there with my husband, daughter and son-in-law. The hotel is well located (museum is only 7km away), is absolutely clean with all amenities I would expect from a Holiday Inn. The rooms were comfortable and cozy. I spent most of my time sightseeing and would return to the hotel simply for sleeping. But my overall experience at the hotel and with the staff was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average HI”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaRick
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the rooms that, as the front desk staff so proudly explained, 'Is one which has yet to be renovated!'. Well I could tell. Window in the room did not close properly so we had some road noise at night. I bit of drab decor, musty smell, loud AC unit, and the bathroom was in desperate need or renovation. As a priority club paltinum member, I was given the 'priviledge' of using the priority club business lounge, which as it turns out, are just 2 desks situated behind the bar and restaurant area, way too noisy to get any work done. Without a doubt, the world's worst location for a HI priority club loung, totaly inadequate. The bar and restaurant (breakfast) are extremely understaffed, long and unacceptable waits for service. Althought the hotel is conveniently located just a couple of minutes from both the RAI train station (to/from airport) as well as the trolley (to/from downtown) I will definately not stay here again, and choose something more central and with a more quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoumyaM
Reviews.Content: A bit noisy than expected. Overall a great value for money hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmenEmmen
Reviews.Content: The price is too expensive for 179 E / night, exclusief breakfast 22 E, internet 15 E and city tax 8 E. The parking is also expensive, 25 E for the hotel guest. The personnel (the blond girl as receptionist) was not kind and a bit bruut! I was not impressed at all for Holiday Inn Hotel in A'dam. The bed was good. Mold every where on the bathroom which makes me worry to take a bath. There is no body lotion. Dinner was expensive and tasted bad. Many bones in the fish, the skin was not crispy and fat. The dessert was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Freindly, Helpful. Dont be putoff by other comments ...”
Reviews.Author: cerbera69
Reviews.Content: Well what is there to say ... Booked though corporate booking system, and arrived without any issues. Hotel Parking was full, but, used the Q Park next door (expensive, but always better to be safe than sorry (28 euro's /24hr)). Checkin was fast and friendly, Rooms, Clean and spacious, all I would expect from a Higher end hotel, for a fraction of the cost. Didnt use the Bar or resteraunt as Eating out in Amsterdam is so convenient. Station Rai is just around the corner, and if you look for the large "Novotel" sign ontop of the building, the Holiday Inn sign is right next to it!!... Bed was very comfortable, although there could have been more pillows, the ones supplied were adequate. I realised I had lost my Euro adaptor, and walked to recieption to ask if they had any. The recieptionists went to great lengths to source me a UK --> euro adaptor, and in the end, came up with a euro Laptop cable "borrowed" from the day staff's PC!!! Checkout was fast, efficient and as I have come to expect, courtest and professionalism was there all the way. You have to remember though, the Dutch have slightly different customs and attitudes to the French or dare I say the Germans. Being familiar with them, any bluntness or directness was not regarded as ignorant, just a way of life. All in all, after reading some remarks about this hotel, I was a little sceptical, but I am very pleased with my visit, and, when Im next in town, will be sure to check Holiday Inn first for availability before considdering much more expensive alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it is advertised to be”
Reviews.Author: jeepwrangler50
Reviews.Content: Lets start simple. This is not a 4 star hotel. Full Stop. This rating is in error. I would not even call this a business hotel. It's a 2-3 star tourist hotel without pool, room service, or other expected amenities. As an advertised 2-3 star or tourist hotel it would be passable. Rooms are not bad, they are reasonably clean as is most of the hotel. There were some stains on our wallpaper and small amounts of mildew in the bathroom. Tourist class: acceptable; Four star: not. I had a problem with the safe and someone came and fixed it in minutes. My experiences with the day staff were good, and the housekeeper for my room was great with my dog and was embarrassed by my offered tips. We ate a couple of meals at the "Vermont" Bar and Restaurant. The lunch / dinner food was good as was the service. The maritime decor conflicted with the list of Vermont towns listed over the bar. When I think Middlebury, I don't think of a lighthouse. Breakfast was tourist class. The Croissants were low-end as were the hot items. They served pancakes with breakfast, but no maple syrup was provided (This is Vermont!) I had reserved two rooms on the hotel web site for the "All in Business Package". The package includes room, wireless internet, breakfast, and 10% discount at the Bar/Restaurant". The evening and night staff however were unfamiliar with the packages sold by the hotel, undertrained in hostel standards of behavior and overall amateur. I checked in around 7:00 PM. It was quick. My reservation was there at the agreed rate. The clerk was not impolite, but seemed to be going through motions. Glaringly missing was any two way conversation or even the typical script telling me about breakfast, internet, parking... No offer was made to assist with my luggage. Nor was any mention made of the package I purchased. I even commented that I was surprised there were not internet codes with the keys. The clerk made no comment. Internet: When I called to ask for codes I was told I would have to pay; and that there was no wireless on my floor. I was also told that I was wrong (yes, wrong) that there was no included internet and that I could in fact not have a voucher. I asked to talk to the manager. I was told "no". I walked downstairs. I asked for the manager. I got a blank stare. I asked again. I was told the manager wasn;t there. Finally I was told I could talk to the Duty Manager after his dinner. Duty manager tells me there is absolutely no free internet. So, I make an offer: I show you my reservation details and if I'm correct you comp me a room. If I'm incorrect I pay. He calls me aggressive and inappropriate. He counter offers: "If you are correct (as in If you can prove to me) that your package gives you this then I will give it to you" I pay 29 bucks for internet, pull my reservation and go back to the desk. I wait another 15 minutes for the Duty Manager to return. I ask a desk clerk if she can have a drink send/brought to me while I wait. She says "No". I finally show my reservation to the Duty Manager. He then tells me they "found" my reservation in their system and yes, I get free internet. I ask about breakfast. I am told yes its also included just give my room number. I drop the wireless part of the discussion. For the remainder of the stay I am not greeted or serviced by any of the evening shift I expected a parking fee of around 25EUR. To my surprise, parking was free if you were able to get a spot in their small lot. Paid parking was right next door and I only had to resort to it one night. What pains me is that the night staff could not explain the parking rule(s). They just didnâ€™t know. When I receive my bill before checkout, I find hundreds of Euros in internet charges, no 10% discount for the meals, and I was double charged for the dog. (15 Euros per night was their advertised rate. The day clerk found the error, not me.) At checkout, the day clerk fixed everything quickly and politely. If I had been on a business trip I would have checked out immediately after arrival. So here is the bottom line: The hotel is not 4 star. I think that large portions of the staff are under-trained and that there exists a lack of process and procedure that ensures that guests receive the proper services, amenities and attention. This is a management issue. About me: I am a 30+ week a year business traveler. This was however a personal trip and I am not usually a Holiday Inn customer. Would I stay here again? At around 150 Euro per-night? Nah.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager, Clogged Sink & Tub, OK Location outside of Amsterdam City Center”
Reviews.Author: SUMMAGOLD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Amsterdam for 4 nights for New Years weekend. Getting to the hotel was easy from Schiphol airport. Take the train to RAI station (about 10 minutes), and walk out of station and turn right, the second building on the right. Be careful because you can miss it, and because you are approaching the back of the building, so the lobby entrance is on the other side; but its just before the Novotel. When we checked in, I asked the person checking us in, who was also the "Duty Manager" for the train or trolley info to get to the city center. He acted like I was bothering him and that he had other important things to do. We were puzzled because there was no other guests in sight. The lobby was empty except for the other staff. I said "Sir, I am asking you for help to get to the city center. Please give me a minute!" I asked him relevant questions like what time does the last trolley come in, if it is running on New Years Eve and New Years Day, etc. After he hurriedly answered my question about the times for the trolley, he proceeded to say "Good Day, Madam". I was shocked and insulted that he could just dismiss me like that, after just checking in, surrounded by our luggage. But it gets worse. A couple of days passed, my husband checked on his credit card, because thats what he does since we have used it so often the last couple of days, he noticed that there was a $700 authorization hold on our card from Holiday Inn. This is crazy because at check in, the Duty Manager asked us for our credit card for any damages and extra services we might incur during our stay. My husband advised him that we had already paid for our stay in full thru Priceline. He said he still requires it. My husband asked how much hold will he putting. He said $70. You could imagine our frustration and anger when we found that the duty manager had in fact charged $700! I hope none of you have to deal with this man. My husband has already put a call into Holiday Inn about him. it took Holiday Inn another couple of days to clear this mess up. Good thing we had other funds, because this could have put a huge damper on our vacation. All in all, even though the hotel is not central, in fact 30 mins away from central Amsterdam, it was still very convenient. It is just less than a block away from the #4 trolley that takes you all the way into the heart of Amsterdam (about 25-30 mins); and about 10 mintues by train to Schiphol Airport. You can also walk to a really great japanese steakhouse from the hotel. Kushi Tei of Tokyo. Walk up north passed RAI center. Its about 15 mins walk. Not bad walk when the trolley wasnt in service during new years eve. My only two complaints is the Duty Manager, and the clogged sink. The shower pressure was very good, but then the tub clogged sometimes too. Like the other reviewers before me, I too, thought the residue after it finally drained out was gross. yuck. Also, there is no locked safe. Which sucked because we had to carry our passports with us the whole time. And we didnt trust to leave it in our room. I have one advice: If you are going to the museums, try to buy the tickets and print out before going, you will thank me when you see the line of people wrapped around the block! The porter at the lobby was kind enough to print Van Gogh museum tickets for us. By the third day we got smart to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Spacious”
Reviews.Author: lizcab452
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not a bad value. Good clean rooms, spacious compared to many European hotel rooms. I have stayed here twice, once for New Years Eve 2008 and again in January 2010. If you are looking for something closer to the red light and the Dam Square area then you should find another hotel. This one is pretty far from those areas, costs about 15 euros for a taxi to get to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice business hotel but 30 minutes from centre”
Reviews.Author: jimster99
Reviews.Content: I paid about $80 plus $15 taxes a night to stay here through the "name your own price" feature on priceline. Normally I would think this fairly expensive for a non-flexible pre-paid booking on a mid-range hotel but Amsterdam is an expensive city. The hotel itself is a perfectly nice but bland and anonymous chain mid-range business class hotel, with all the usual amenities (flatscreen tv, tea and coffee, etc). If you have stayed in other holiday inns you know what to expect. The biggest downside is the location - it's about 3 or 4 miles south of the city centre in the 'convention district', but it's easy to get from the city centre in about half an hour either by tram (number 3 stops right outside the hotel) or by metro from the city cente, or you could walk in about an hour. The other downside is that this hotel tries to gouge extra cash out of you at every step - in particular: (i) late check-out attracts massive fines (something like â‚¬30/hour!!), (ii) there isa parking charge of â‚¬22 a day, which for an out-of-centre place with a large park seems a bit mean (iii) breakfast was poor value at â‚¬20 a day per person, and (iv) no free internet although every other hotel in amsterdam I've stayed at offers this feature. If you're driving I recommend parking at one of the "park and ride" (P+R) carparks outside the city centre which only charge â‚¬6 a day and then getting a tram or train into the centre; which saves having to navigate the busy centre.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay but wouldn't choose again”
Reviews.Author: Bobbykat
Reviews.Content: My spouse was on a business trip and I joined him so I had to stay at this hotel close to his work. Hotel was nice and rooms also but we were totally appalled by the price of internet use in the room:22 euros for 24 hours. That was outrageous. Parking on public street close to the hotel was 8,50 euros/day. Cheaper that at the hotel garage. We got a good deal on the room price, otherwise I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but would choose somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: NileGuy77
Reviews.Content: We took this hotel as recomended by our friend. The hotel had a nice reception but we were taken back by first the reception staff (very cold) and then the room was nothing to write home about. There was not even a porter to take the luggage. Furniture a bit run down, bathroom not very good condition, and I was surprised to see a bottle cap which was under the bed and actually stayed there during all our trip! Even when I called the reception to ask for an electric adaptor for my mobile charger they asked me to come downstairs instead of sending one up. Now I wouldnt say all staff are bad, there were some friendly staff but ones who couldnt give a damn. But again a successful hotel has the best staff available. Good experiences: some friendly staff, allowed us to store our luggage after check out till time of flight, next to the tram station so it was easy to get to the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a repeat Guest and the Staff keeps on delighting me!”
Reviews.Author: JVCMaine
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Holiday Inn is my home away from home. The Staff always welcomes me back with a warm smile and a friendly greeting; they make me feel like part of the family. Every hotel has the same firnishings, this Hotel has personality, the difference is the values, attitude and character of the Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fine of 50 euro if you wet the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Marja-Alain
Reviews.Content: As "gold" member of Holiday Inn Hotels we try to always stay in one of their hotels. Also for Amsterdam. Even if the reception is re-decorated, the rooms are NOT. We arrived late afternoon and just dropped our luggage in the room. When we finally installed in our room, we noticed that there were NO towels, NO drinking glasses/to brush you teeth. The minibar was emptied (hotel regulations) ???) In the bathroom was a notice that if you left the bathroom wet you would be charged 50 Euro. We did not feel very welcome (home) Very basic hotel. Will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, extortiante bar prices though!”
Reviews.Author: kittykat100
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of minutes walk from the Station, it only takes 10 mins or so to Centraal Amsterdam via Metro. The room we had was a corner room and was huge with a super king bed. Unfortunately you could only get wireless from the 9th floor up and we were on the 8th floor where you had to use a cable. The rooms are very nicely decorated and very clean, the shower was lovely and powerful over the bath. The hotel is modern and decorated very nicely. The only gripe we had was the mad cost of drinks.. and yes I know its a hotel but even sooo... 1 pint of lager and 1 brandy and coke = 16 euro! Needless to say that was the only couple of drinks we had there. We booked on the 2 for 1 package with holiday and got a fabulous rate. I wouldn't hesitate to revisit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustMe1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in august. It was a really good holiday inn hotel. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean... You can reach the city center by tram.. only takes about 20 minutes! Really easy!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: e2637
Reviews.Content: After a long drive, we found this Holiday Inn along the highway just outside Amsterdamâ€™s city center. The hotel is very plain from the outside and has a basic reception area and front lobby. The hotel room was slightly below the standards I have seen at other Holiday Inns. The sheets were worn and the bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom had clothes from a previous nightâ€™s guest hanging behind the door. Only the very basics (small towels, bar of soap, etc.) are provided in the bathroom. Overall, however, the room was adequate for just one night. The next morning, we rented gasoline powered scooters from the hotel (pictured). The hotel also rents bicycles. The scooters allowed us to travel to all parts of the city in the designated bicycle lanes and, for the most part, out of car traffic. The hotel employee that helped us with the rental was particularly nice and accommodating. In fact, all the staff we dealt with at this hotel were above average from a customer service perspective. Parking at the hotel is expensive. There is also an exorbitant fee for wireless internet access. We did not eat at the hotelâ€™s restaurant but the menu and prices seemed reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bring your car, but bring your own glasses”
Reviews.Author: Roland m
Reviews.Content: PLUS Â· 4-star standard of rooms, staff and breakfast buffet. Â· The location is terrific if you arrive in Amsterdam by car. The hotel is easy to find, very close to the Amsterdam Ring exit S109. Â· It's very easy to get into the city even though the hotel is quite far out in the conference areas. A tram leaves from the end stop about five minutes from the hotel, and takes you to the city centre in approx. 15 minutes. MINUS Â· The parking on the hotel premises isn't free. Costs you 25 Euros per 24 hrs for an ordinary outside parking space, and is even higher per hour if you park your car for a shorter period than 24 hrs.Should be possible to get an even lower price if you stay 48 or 72 hours. Try to find cheaper parking in the close neighbourhood if you have time and energy for it. We didn't. Â· The tourist price gives you tourist standard; "there are no free lunches", e.g.there are no glasses, not even plastic cups in the room. Had to be picked up at the reception. This is the first time in all my years of travel that glasses or cups have been missing in a room. Â· Mini-bar in room was locked, we couldn't even open it to chill you own beverages. Â· The cleaning lady missed that we had a triple room at every daily cleaning. We had to pick up additional towels every night.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with no food”
Reviews.Author: suen0s1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to our office in Amsterdam so we often book there. I have generally found it to be an average chain hotel with not too much to recommend it besides convenience but it was OK for short stays, until now. I was booked in for a week in July, and fell victim to their so called "summer schedule" - something which was not advertised to us at the time of booking, or checking in. I watched the hotel amenities disappear day by day during my week. On Sunday we were told that the restaurant was closed for the summer - but there was a limited (and adequate) menu available in the bar. On the Monday, this menu had been cut back to a handful of items - most barely edible - the lowlight being pre-cooked hamburgers. Luckily I was able to eat outside the hotel for a few nights, but when back on Thursday, there was no food at all available. And then on Friday, my mini-bar was mysteriously emptied, so no drink or snacks available in the room either. I have stayed in hotels with no food service before and often I prefer to eat outside the hotel. But when I am travelling for business - often coming and going at odd hours - and staying in an area with no other food options at night - any hotel I am staying in has to offer some food options, and certainly shouldn't cut them off with no warning. Other issues - inadequate room cleaning - dirty glasses and trash left in the room, used items not replaced.. No toiletries available in the room. Ice machines available on alternate floors, but nothing to collect the ice in. And if you want anything after about 10pm, good luck - I found that no-one answered any of the phones. And then finally - the hotel questionnaires which were displayed prominently in my room on Sunday were mysteriously removed later in the week. A case of valuing the guest's opinion until they might say something unfavourable. Well here is my opinion - "unacceptable" This is not a business hotel, and no way is it woirth a 4* rating. Please stay away.,

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money and beware summer service”
Reviews.Author: bbzz
