Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel is relatively cheap but a daily 22 Euro surcharge for internet access increases costs significantly. There is no restaurant menu available during summer season and food options included pre-cooked burgers - I have no idea how that works with health and safety. Rooms are clean but amenities and service poor and unreliable. There are no irons in the room unless called for and no answer to telephone calls on any of the service numbers later in the evening. Towels disappeared over the course of my stay until I was down to the barest minimum. A kettle and tea things offered on day one also disappeared for the rest of the trip. Breakfast food is best missed. I am sure this place works fine for cheap family travel but it doesn't work for business customers.

Reviews.Title: “Terible value for money”
Reviews.Author: couloirjunkie
Reviews.Content: The most over-priced hotel I've ever stayed in. For â‚¬170 per night, you get old, small cheap towels, rough toilet paper, non-dairy creamer as the best option for your tea, expensive (â‚¬12 per hour!) internet access in the rooms, an average restaurant at outrageous prices (â‚¬22 euros for a vege main course!), no toiletries, stciky, old carpet, and the bar was closed at 1am. It's in the middle of an industrial estate and nowhere to go to apart from the in house "bar". It's not even particularly close to the conference centre (10 minutes walk through a bulding site). There were two English speaking channels on the television (BBC world and CNN), and the rest was Dutch free to air (i.e. minimal cable). God-awful and I would never go back. Makes me unlikely ever to use Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, clean, nice decor...standard Holiday Inn. Not really anything within walking distance...but the bus/tram station to Central Amsterdam is just a few footsteps away. Paid parking lot. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Reasonably Price but with add on costs”
Reviews.Author: Rebel1Manchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is what you expect, friendly staff. Compared to the other hotels of equivalent standing it is 20% cheaper, and Breakfast was included in the price. Nice not to have to pay â‚¬20-25. Breakfast was a typical hotel breakfast, some of the fruit that is offered like the pineapple is tinned not fresh. Found the evening meal over priced for what was received. The gym is very tired with some old treadmills and cross trainers. The room was clean, shower worked. A pet hate is that the bathrooms are internal and have no external windows. However you can get the fast tras to Amsterdam, a train direct to the Airport and a tram which takes a nice view towards Amsterdam. Hence location is not too bad. There is also a lovely park across the road from the hotel which I took a really pleasant walk through.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to relax”
Reviews.Author: ias3458
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn when I was returning from Austria after attending Summer Sales Meeting. I really enjoyed my stay stay in this hotel although it was a little bit away from the city centre. The environment around was great and we could relax a lot. The stay was made more comfortable by the extremely dedicated and helping staff who were ever ready to serve us. I enjoyed my every bit of stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend to enjoy Amsterdam. The hotel is outside of the centre, Amsterdam Zuid. So, for sure not walking distance to Amsterdam city centre, but the hotel is about a 2 minute walk from a tram line, brining you straight to Amsterdam city centre. Furthermore, the hotel is also a 2 minute walk from the railway station, which is only one stop from Amsterdam Schiphol airport. In that way, it is a convenient place. We paid about 90 Euros, no breakfast per night. The rooms are clean and large enough. Nothing spectacular, an average Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, sink clogged, extras expensive, not central”
Reviews.Author: earlysunrise
Reviews.Content: HOTEL IMPRESSION: Holiday Inn is an interesting brand, in Oklahoma City it's a 2* hotel, in San Francisco a 3* hotel, and here a 4*. The lobby looks nice, the staff is multi-langual and friendly, and there's concierge for your luggage. From the outside, the building just looks a big block, but it's confusing that the main entrance is from the west, and there's a side-entrance that closes for the night, coming from the north. The concierge was nice, telling that there's an Albert Heijn supermarket in a mall close to the hotel, if you drive De Boelelaan west to the next stoplight, and then just right again on the next stoplight. It's a 2 minute drive, and the Albert Heijn (whose operator Ahold also own all the Stop&Shops in the US, BTW) is open until 10 p.m. ROOM: The room is of decent size, nice features (flat screen TV), looks nice, is clean. It's confusing though, there's no menu for the restaurant laying around, part of the restaurant's menu is inbuilt into the TV menu system. I would have preferred a printed menu. There's a mini bar (4,50 Euro for a 0,33 can of coke). The windows of the room do not open. The AC took a whole while until getting the hotel room warm on these freezing cold November days. The thing that I did not like was that the sink in the bathroom was clogged. Like the water did not go away. Stood there for hours until it was gone. Looked quite yucky. This did not apply for the shower. Showers nice, the usual difficulty to adjust water temperature though. Two milimeters can be the difference between burning hot, and freezing cold. EXTRAS EXPENSIVE: Parking is 25 Euro for 24h, and breakfast is 20 Euro per person. WiFi only available in the lobby, starting at 5 Euro for 15 minutes. Cable internet only in the rooms, available for 22 Euro for 24h. Paid movies are part of a 25 Euro for 24h Entertainment flatrate, except for music albums, which are 3 Euro for 24h of use. In the weekends, there's free street parking available right next to the hotel. LOCATION: This hotel is right on the corner of De Boelelaan and Europaboulevard (don't let yourself be fooled by the mark in Google Maps, it's in the wrong place), and it's not central, but ca. 7km away from Amsterdam's main station (Amsterdam Centraal), though I bidded on the Amsterdam center zone at Priceline. It's right next to the Europaboulevard exit of the A10 though, so access is easy. The hotel itself actually is close to the RAI convention center, probably it's good for that (only 5 mins walk). The tram line number 4 starts right in front of the hotel, taking you to the town center. It takes 30 minutes though, until it arrives at Amsterdam Centraal, so if you wanna go to the main station, the Metro line 51 may be your better choice, though it's more expensive, as it only takes 14 minutes to the main station, and the ride is way less shaky and much more comfortable. The metro also runs every 10 minutes, just like the tram... BOTTOM LINE: It's a very good, clean hotel, for 75$ a night on Priceline. But the extras are really rediculously expensive, the confusing entry, the not so central location and the clogged sink also brought my overall impression down to giving two stars at Tripadvisor, taking the 4* standard the hotel sets out for itself.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: Batta83
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a fascinating city, but I always find it hard there to get hotels for a good value that are well suited for families. The Holyday Inn is such a hotel. It is not in the inner city but 5 minutes from the subway and train station RAI, which means you can get there by public transport easily if you arrive by plane or train. It also takes you 15 minutes to get to the inner city with the metro. It is an ideal starting point for exploring the city and its surroundings. The hotel is localized next to the Amsterdam conference center and they offer really good rates if there are no conferences and also on weekends. The rooms are nice and they also offer a sumptuous breakfast buffet. The rooms with two double beds sleep a family of four and could be a little bigger, but are ok for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: gleagle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2008 for a conference at the Rai convention centre. The hotel is not in the centre of Amsterdam but is in an excellent loctaion for the Rai centre. It was approximatley 5mins walk to the conference centre, and 5mins walk to the train and tram station which take you into the centre of Amsterdam and Schipol Airport. The rooms were clean and pleasant and the hotel had a nice restaurant and a bar which served bar snacks. I would recommend this hotel if you want a hotel in easy reach of the city centre and Schipol Airport, or for it's location to the Rai centre.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: mytuppenceworth
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn was fine. Alittle expensive when I compare the price to the Holiday Inn in Munich where I stayed 2 night later. The room was fine. It had everything you could need. I didn't eat breakfast so can't comment on that. The location is no great shakes but you can get the No 4 tram to city centre. It was only a couple of minutes walk to the tram stop. I'd plan to stay somewhere different when next in Amsterdam, somewhere closer to city centre. Good hairdryer

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyleyva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a fifteen minute tram ride from downtown Amsterdam. The check in was very easy and the staff was very nice. The hotel itself was very nice. The rooms were large and clean and the bathroom was exceptional. Our sofa bed had no sheets on it when we pulled it out so I asked the maid that was down the hall for some. He did not speak English but he must have told someone we needed something because about 2 minutes later the hotel staff was at our door with everything we needed. I liked the fact that the hotel was not downtown as it was nice to be able to get away from the city center. The only drawback was that there were no restaurants or stores to get food in the general area. There is a shopping center down the road about a mile that does have a grocery store but its a little far if you have no car. We took a cab from the train station because we had no idea where to go and that cost around 40 Euros but the tram #4 goes directly from the train station to the RAI station and only cost aout 7Euros for 4 people. We would definitely stay here again. The surrounding area was pretty and the hotel was really comfortable. We did not eat in the restaurant but it was usually busy with business travelers so I would guess it was good although from the menu we looked at it was a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near convention center”
Reviews.Author: SRAinSA
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference at the RAI (pronounced "rye") convention center at the end of May 2008, so we stayed here 4 nights. It was a good experience overall. Breakfast was pricey (20 euros for the buffet), and we only did that once. We had requested a "deluxe" room to accommodate our 2 kids, and were surprised to find the room had 2 double beds and a small sofa. If the sofa had been pulled out we wouldn't have had room for luggage, but didn't need the extra space. It was a good sized room. The room was clean and the bathroom was fine. The kids like the chocolates put on our pillows each night. The front desk was helpful, making suggestions for sightseeing, transportation, selling tram tickets, etc. The hotel was a bit out of the way, but price and location to the convention center made it good for us. We took the train from the Airport to RAI station (different line than going to central station) and had less than 5 minute walk to the hotel. The tram stop was between hotel and train station and very efficient. Trams left every 10 minutes or so. It took about 30 minutes to get to the city center. We used strippenkart, which is a series of 15 "strips" for the tram. Each trip to downtown cost 3 strips each way, but you get a discount if you buy them in bulk (6.90 euros for 15 strips). Strips are stamped on the tram, and are good for 1 hour on any tram. Transfers are easy. RAI convention center is about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Nearest restaurants are on the other side of the convention center, along with a Albert Heijn grocery store (good for prepared food, fruit, bread, cheese, and most other needs).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRSDRC
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel - stayed here for 2 nights. Location not so central although there is no problem in getting to the centre as the transport is very regular (trains & trams). I have stayed in a central location also but hotel not so good for value. This was definitely better value for money but be prepared to travel to the centre

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rangas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for three nights with the other half recently. Rooms: The rooms are large by european standards and have two double beds even when you book for two adults only. Accessibility: Ten minuters from schipol.Take the stoptrein from Schipol and get off at RAI Amsterdam.Come out of the station and turn right and right again at the corner of the building you pass next.Its a less than 3 minute walk to the hotel. To go into town take the GVB tram line 4.Retrace the route to RAI station ....you will pass the Drentepark station (50 meters from the RAI....and the origin point of line 4 and therefore always easy to get seats for the 15 minute ride into the city.) Location: In the industrial section of Amsterdam.....therefore not too many restaurants around ....food at the hotel is expensive.... but plenty of restaurants enroute to the city centre on line 4 Overall: Absolutely no complaints and a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel in A'dam”
Reviews.Author: GrandP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Amsterdam for 2 nights in March. It was very easy to reach from the Rai Metro stop outside the city center. The reception staff was very, very friendly and spoke excellent English. Our room was a standard king, which was on the smaller side, but very comfortable. The bathroom was large and modern and extremely clean. We spent some time in the bar drinking very expensive beer, but the service was great. Overall our experience was great and we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Gsalex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great alternative to expensive rooms in the city center, since it's just a three-minute walk to the RAI train station. Buy a day pass on the metro line and save money on accommodations. It's also very convenient to/from Schipol Airport by rail. We were able to get a very good rate by bidding online, and since it was Easter week and there were no business travelers they upgraded us to an executive suite on one of the upper floors. Really nice room, great view, comfortable beds and ultra clean. All the amenities you'd expect for a good business-class hotel. The only drawback was that the nearest area with restaurants is about a 15 minute walk. So it's about as quick to take a train into town for dinner. But we were quite happy with the hotel and it was much better than a typical Holiday Inn in the states. Note: Tourists might want to check on whether a convention is in town before booking, since this hotel caters primarily to the nearby RAI convention center. You'll probably find better deals on weekends and holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: smardie
Reviews.Content: stayed one night at the Holiday Inn in Amsterdam. The hotel was not in the main city center, but within a very short walk was the tram into the city. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was modern and fairly big and a very nice bed. The bathroom was also nice, with a large tub. My only complaint was the breakfast, it was a buffet and it cost $23.00 and was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at the Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: TallTexan82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Amsterdam for 5 days in late December with my girlfriend. We had stayed in the Amsterdam city center on the first leg or our trip and I booked the Holiday Inn through P*riceline ($95 US) as a less expensive alternative on our last leg. The hotel is located on the "outer ring" of the city, but it is less than a 3 mile walk to the heart of Amsterdam and about 1.5 miles to the Van Gogh museum. It is located right next to the RAI station and the beginning of tram line directly into the city. The proximity to the RAI station proved to be a great benefit as it was only 1 stop from the airport and allowed us to avoid the obscenely expensive Dutch taxis. It also made a day trip to Haarlem very accessible. We stayed in a large room with a comfortable king bed and good bathroom. It was larger than most European rooms and much better than the Holiday Inns where I have stayed in the United States. Ultimately, I found staying at the Holiday Inn to be a great budget alternative to staying in the city center (which I also recommend if the price is right). It is located across the road from a nice city park (with a large hedge maze - recommended for kids and adults) with easy access to the city. My only regret is not being able to visit during the warmer months. Renting a bike (I think you can rent them under the RAI station) and exploring the city would have been awesome. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: JudyGrace
Reviews.Content: All of the B&Bs were booked up as it was during the holidays. Our travel agent suggested the Holiday Inn. It was located right next to the Station Rai railway which is only two or three stops from the airport and very cheap (3 euros each way) and next to a tram stop which brings you to downtown within 15 minutes. The hotel was clean, the service excellent, and the hot American-style breakfast very good and worth the extra cost. We would definitely recommend staying there and plan to return next Spring or Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base”
Reviews.Author: shayes7
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a suprise visit to Amsterdam for my birthday on August Bank Holiday weekend and we stayed at the HI Amsterdam. Once we got to check in, the receptionist upgraded us to a Executive room, which was very spacious and had nice clear views. Now being as it's Amsterdam and a fairly big City, i did expect the rooms to be on the smaller side but was very suprised. Bearing in mind the actual hotel isn't central, it is about 2 miles out the the center. Don't let that put you off as over the road from the hotel you have the Train station which goes to and from Schipol Airport. Also it is very easy to get in and out of the City as there is a Tram Service around the corner. Takes approximately 15 mins to get into town, but you do get to see all the wonderful buildings on your way to the City. The hotel is very friendly and perfect for a City break away. We did have breakfast at this hotel and it has to be said it was a treat. As it is a buffet breakfast, you can eat as much as you want and you will be full for the rest of the day until tea. We also ate Dinner at the hotel, and was expecting to pay high prices but was pleasently suprised to find the prices reasonable. I do recommend you eat at the hotel as this was a very pleasent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at RAI”
Reviews.Author: luke.traveller
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is located near RAI, a conference center. Booking this hotel was mainly a price issue for us, as their prices are very competitive. The airport transfer is very easy by train, the fare is EUR 2.50 one-way, the ride takes only 10 min. and the trains run every 15 minutes. The train station RAI is only 5 min. away from the hotel. Going downton is also easy by tram. For frequent trips it is best to buy a 1/2/3-day pass, we paid EUR 13.50 for 3 days of unlimited rides. Breakfast was excellent, very nice selection, it comes at a price of EUR 20.--. For cheaper breakfast options: there is nothing near the hotel, except a little convenience store at RAI station that may sell sandwiches or coffee... you may have to go downtown for more choice. There was no service directory in our room. When checking out, we found out the service directory was on the TV now..... we found out too late, as we missed breakfast one day, being too late. There is a historic windmill only 10 min. walking time from the hotel... ask at the reception, they will give you directions how to get there if you are keen to see it. Overall, we had a very nice stay at this hotel, I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HFriedman
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel. it doesn't look much on the outside but it is very warm and cozy on the inside. the rooms are nice and clean. the personnel very friendly and efficient. I stayed there for 5 days for a conference at the RAI and walked 5 minutes to the conference. I also went into the city center every evening using the nearby tram 4 which was really convinient. it is also very close to the metro and trains to get anywhere you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: MarlonGobitz
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel quite often for business and am always very pleased with the service, friendliness, free upgrades to executive rooms, decent breakfast (although they don't serve soy milk, eventhough requested). The executive rooms are wonderful, beds are great. Some rooms have a whirlpool, free complimentary drinks (2), chocolate, etc. No complaints whatsoever. If you're looking for a hotel only two trainstops from the airport and you can live with the fact you are not downtown amsterdam (15 - 20 minutes traveling), then this is the place to stay for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BreilBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, and loved it. Perfect rooms, good food. They told us the lobby is impressive, but they were rebuilding it and was totally closed. Easy acces to the city centre with the tramline that stops next to the hotel. Very friendly staff. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “really nice place - just a few small quibbles”
Reviews.Author: Stratus42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August for a night and had very few complaints considering we got the room for a STEAL from Priceline.com. The rooms were big, spacious, modern, the staff were friendly and the place was conveniently located next to a tram station for easy access to the town center. The bathroom had modern fittings and everything was clean and nice. That breakfast wasn't included in the room price, and that we weren't informed of this BEFORE eating it, is a small quibble. However, it was only â‚¬10 each and it was a REALLY GOOD buffet breakfast. - still â‚¬10 is quite a lot - and there are NO OTHER options in the neighbourhood that we could find The rooms, particularly the smoking-permitted rooms - could have done with better ventilation. With only 1 smoker in our party of 2, the smoke quickly filled up the room... the smoker in question resorted to smoking in the bathroom where the ventilation was better - none of the windows opened. The hotel was under renovations when we visited but this, while unsightly in the lobby and on the restaurant level, did not cause any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, recently renovated hotel that offers included breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fiammybe
Reviews.Content: We go to Amsterdam every year for the same event. This was the fifth time in a row, and because the location of the event changes, we have changed hotel almost every year. The Holiday Inn Amsterdam is located on a 2-minute walk from the RAI subway and train station, which brings you in a short 10-minute drive to the Amsterdam Central Station. Very easy to get to the centre of town. It was mentioned on the Holiday Inn website that the hotel had been recently renovated. The room was clean, no smoke odours were present (we asked for a non-smoking room) and of acceptable size. Not too big, but there was ample space for a sofa and a table next to the beds. Breakfast was 15â‚¬ per person, but the hotel offers a breakfast-included option, which is considerably cheaper, certainly when you don't travel alone. Breakfast was very extensive and high quality, with the staff always willing to help when you have special requirements (or you just want your eggs in a fashion they don't do normally). Nice atmosphere also, the breakfast room was cosy, and not too big. I'll be back next year, this was a flawless stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Radha_7
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was also ok as the hotel could easily be reached from the airport and public transport to the city was freaquent. I didn't like the fact that there were no cafes or restaurants in the area and that the hotel exploited this charging 20 euros for a breakfast that should have cost less than 10. The hotel was also greedy when it came to other things. For instance they charged 0,35 euros for internet, a service most hotels provide for free. Another thing I didn't like is that the hotels show clips from pornographic movies (pay tv). I would not have liked my children to coincidentally flip to these channels. It is also an experience I could have done without. I do not like hotels that sell porno at all, but I could accept it if these films were showed on request only.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy experience”
Reviews.Author: SANNY078
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with family in August 2007. We were 2 adults and 2 children. The location is secluded with nothing around. Not at all suitable if holidaying with family especially children. The staff are anything but friendly and courteous. They need training on Customer service and understanding the needs of families. Almost everything had to be ordered twice. When you call for the second time (after having given 30-45 minutes time), the new person on the line " first mentions it was not me you called so I am not responsible" and then tries to help (no team work). Very difficult to get help if you are traveling with heavy luggage. Would never stay there. It definitely does not maintain Holiday Inn standards.Being close to the airport would suit the transit passenger who needs a bed to sleep overnight and take a shower. Nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: JustTripping
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Amsterdam for our 30th Anniversary . The hotel was easy to find from the airport which is good when you are jetlagged and tired. There was renovations taking place, however, from our room it wasn't that noticeable. The rooms were very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was convenient to Tram 4 which would take you into the city. We liked going to the city during the day and evening, then returning to a nice, quiet hotel away from the city, for a good night sleep. We didn't eat at the hotel, but did shop at the gift shop and found it very pleasant and reasonable. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average!”
Reviews.Author: LondonNatty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very ordinary. It was clean enough but the bathroom was very old and not that nice. The room was comforable enough and the bed linen was clean. The hotel restaurant was nice but a bit pricey. Room service was ok but again a bit over-priced. It's a long way out of Amsterdam - about 20-25 minutes by Tram number 4, which is located right near the hotel. Amsterdam itself is quite horrible! It is very dirty with rubbish all over the streets. We did our best to go on tours away from the city. The tours were not as good as we had hoped for. Overall, the hotel was just ok, but if you want good quality don't stay at the Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Lucky?”
Reviews.Author: Fifer9
Reviews.Content: Third visit here because the first two were so great as reported in previous reviews. Still a good hotel with nice rooms and good transport links to the centre of course. What was wrong this time? No one member of staff made any impression. That's not a problem as everything was fine. But on the previous occasions, staff at the hotel made us feel like we mattered. In fact, the reason we've returned here to celebrate special family occasions is down to one member of staff, now retired, who made such a great impression on us on our first visit. She won our repeat business; nobody did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient family stay”
Reviews.Author: liverpoolwelsh
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day stay at this Hoiday Inn with my family (2 kids age 11 and 8). We booked this hotel because it was the only one we could find (easily) which had family rooms to accommodate all 4 of us:with breakfast included. From the outside the hotel was uninspiring: it was in a business type paryk near a very busy road, with a horrid dirty pond of water in front. However, inside it was clean and comfortabler and decent value. It was v easy to get into the city centre (20 mins by tram from just outside the hotel. The staff were all v friendly. On the whole, a fine base for a trip, good value, but a bit further out than would have been ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, easy to find”
Reviews.Author: Wdrob
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in May at the Holiday Inn in Amsterdam based on the reviews. The location was great, next to the train station and easy access to the highway. Parking was a little expensive given your out in the suburbs and there are lots of open spaces around. Had dinner in the dinning room which was excellent. I recommend the Halibut it was excellent. The caesar salad was ok, but not traditional north american style. Room was a good size with lots of English speaking tv stations which was a big bonus, after having to watch CNN and BBC news for the previous few nights. If I went back to Amsterdam I would definate consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grest for Flexibility”
Reviews.Author: JFDevizes
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay away from hurly burly of centre of City. Tram no. 4 great - always one waiting! Train service also great - both within 3-4 minute walk of Hotel - advantage you have is it is end of line for Tram hence so easy to catch! Staff at Hotel - really friendly. 4 in family room (2 x large beds a real squish but get what you pay for). Air con. noisy and as ever struggled with fact couldn't open a window!!! Few tips - Hotel food we found expensive but good - soon adds up though if you are a family on a budget! Plenty of Albert Heijns (Supermarkets) in City and on way back on Tram from City to Hotel - OK gereral supermarket... Brill. Sirop Waffles (don't bother with tourist versions - half the price of them and really good...FYI Roombotter (rough spelling) means butter which is trad. type and best!!! Discovered great Thai Restaurant roughly half way on tram from City to Hotel (left hand side of road as heading out of City - also has Albert Heijn nearby. Great food and really charismatic host - near to Canal Bridge nr. Victorie Plein stop, Not cheap but chaper than hotel and great entertainment from host. Ann Frank House and Van Gogh queues for entrance at venues real pain and very long for Ann Frank - TIP go to Centraal Station... opposite main entrance is a large ticket bureau...go in there pay for tickets and they give you a time slot of one hour for admission on date/time you want. When you get to Ann franks/Van Gogh go to pre-booked tickets entrance - no need to queue and get in staright away - commission charge really minimal and worth it! You get discounted Strippenkarts there to. Late tip for Keukenof (bulbfields etc.). Best bet go to Schipol airport - easy on train from Hotel and book with small travel company in arrivals/departures - can't remember their name but on Keukenhof Website. Price includes Bus fare and entrance ... real no hassle stuff and accept credit cards which are not accepted in anywhere near so many places as UK. Really glad to have gone with them - avoided all the massive main route traffic jams, and got bonus of drive through actual bulbfields which others "charge" for as extra as part of trip. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Way Better than a American Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: aydaciya
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent four days at this Holiday Inn and loved it. Here is why we recommend it: -Super friendly staff. We arrived at the hotel at 6 am and were prepared to beg the front desk to allow us to check-in 8 hours early. We even considered paying a half day's rate. But the night manager immediately approved our early check-in free of charge. We didn't even have to ask nicely. -Clean and modern rooms. We didnâ€™t expect much from this hotel, after all it is a Holiday Inn. But our standard room was comparable to a four-star Hilton in the states. The bed was comfortable, the shower had a massage shower head, and the room service was decent. -Location. The hotel is about a 15 minute metro ride and 20 minute tram ride from downtown. It was nice to hang out in a residential neighborhood rather than with the tourists. Plus, it is only two stops away from the airport via the suburban rail line. Don't waste money on a cab. Take the train from the airport. Here are the few things that upset up: -The high-speed internet cost 17 Euros per day. -Commuting to the museums did start to annoy us by the end of our trip, but we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Standard of Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: tincan&co
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam (17th -19th Mar). We (4 people) arrived at Central Station and took a taxi to the hotel (22 euro's). I was a bit worried that the hotel would be too far from the city centre but 22 euro's between four people isn't bad. Looking at the hotel from the outside we were a bit worried that the hotel would not live up to our expectations but on entering we found the hotel to be great. Decor was very nice and the bedrooms has recently been refurbished and seemed larger than average with big windows, mini bar, flat screen tv, workstation and an oversided bed. Like the other reviews state the tram stop is practically outside the hotel and I would say tram 4 takes less than 15 minutes into the centre of Amsterdam (near the flower market) for nearly 3 euro's. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam for a short break however if you plan to stay longer than a few days I would suggest a hotel nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NohoCouple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days when visiting Amsterdam. The hotel itself isn't near the downtown area at all, but that's ok. We chose it because it was a 5-minute walk to the metro and then a 20-minute ride to downtown. The rooms here are on the bigger size, and we found the staff to be super friendly and gave great directions to get us to the Keukenhof which was an hour away. My wife found it very funny they have a restaurant called The Vermont (great food!) since she's from Vermont. WHen checking out we saw that they did add an extra 20 euros a day for breakfast when we never ate breakfast there. They took it off our bill without a problem when we pointed that out. Overall, it's a great place!

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: brazilian_tourist
Reviews.Content: Just arrived from a 5 day leisure trip in Amsterdam. Our experience at holiday inn was extremely fantastic! Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast had many options to chose from, room and bathroom were above expectations. We agree with other reviewers when it comes to distance to Amsterdam downtown, but in a very short walk distance (less than 2 minutes) it is possible to take tram 4 to major city tourist attractions (it takes around 15 to 20 minutes - tickets can be purchase with discount in the hotel). RAI Station is also in a very short distance and from there it is possible to go to Schiphol Airport and several other locations. No complaints at all!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: De Boelelaan 2, Amsterdam 1083 HJ, The Netherlands
